intro: Rinorea longicuspis, commonly known as the long-toothed rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
